name: Lemon Ginger Scones with Brown Rice Flour and Agave Nectar
author: Magdalinka
summary: My mother-in-law loved my scones, but she doesn't take well to gluten or sugar, so after a few experiments I had gluten-free, diabetic-friendly deliciousness!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon lemon juice, or more to taste
directions: Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt in a mixing bowl
Cut the butter into the flour mixture with a knife or pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs
Whisk together the egg, milk, agave nectar, lemon zest, lemon juice, and ginger in a separate bowl; stir into the flour mixture until moistened
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead briefly, for five or six turns
Pat or roll the dough out into a 1/2-inch-thick round
Cut into 8 wedge-shaped pieces and place onto the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes
